SEARCH
Package ddmin

Class AbstractDDPlus

java.lang.Object
ddmin.AbstractDDPlus
public class AbstractDDPlus extends Object
Implements delta debugging algorithms to identify minimal unsatisfiable subsets (MUS) within Alloy models. This abstract class provides the foundation for executing the delta debugging process, utilizing the IDDPlusTest interface for testing subsets of the model.

  • Method Details

    • dd

      public static List<Object> dd(List<Object> input, DataTransportObject dto)
      Starts the delta debugging algorithm by partitioning the input set and recursively narrowing down to identify the minimal unsatisfiable subset.
      Parameters:
      input - The list of objects (model elements) to be debugged.
      dto - The DataTransportObject containing configuration and state for the debugging session.
      Returns:
      A list of objects representing the minimal unsatisfiable subset.

    • ddAux

      private static List<Object> ddAux(List<Object> input, List<Object> r, DataTransportObject dto)
      Auxiliary method for recursive delta debugging calls. It splits the input set, tests subsets, and combines results to find the minimal unsatisfiable subset.
      Parameters:
      input - The current subset of objects to test.
      r - A list of objects that have been identified as relevant to the unsatisfiability.
      dto - The DataTransportObject providing context and settings for the test.
      Returns:
      A list of objects representing a (more) minimal unsatisfiable subset.

    • partitionIntoTwoSubsets

      private static List<List<Object>> partitionIntoTwoSubsets(List<Object> c)
      Partitions the given list into two approximately equal subsets.
      Parameters:
      c - The list of objects to partition.
      Returns:
      A list containing two lists, each a subset of the original list.

    • ddPlus

      private static List<Object> ddPlus(List<Object> input, DataTransportObject dto)
      Enhanced delta debugging algorithm that handles unresolved cases by increasing granularity and retesting subsets.
      Parameters:
      input - The list of objects (model elements) to be debugged.
      dto - The DataTransportObject containing configuration and state for the debugging session.
      Returns:
      A list of objects representing the minimal unsatisfiable subset, considering unresolved cases.

    • dd3

      private static List<Object> dd3(List<Object> input, List<Object> r, DataTransportObject dto, int n)
      Performs a refined delta debugging algorithm to identify the minimal unsatisfiable subset (MUS) within the given set of constraints or elements. The `dd3` method may implement an advanced version of delta debugging that optimizes the search for MUS by iteratively partitioning the input set and evaluating subsets for satisfiability. This method is designed to handle complex cases with higher efficiency, possibly incorporating strategies to deal with dependencies or to accelerate the convergence towards the MUS.
      Parameters:
      input - A List of Objects representing the current subset of elements or constraints to be analyzed. This set is part of the Alloy model under investigation for unsatisfiability.
      r - A List of Objects that have been determined to be relevant in the context of the current debugging iteration. This list helps in refining the search and focusing on promising subsets.
      dto - The DataTransportObject that carries configuration settings, model information, and provides a mechanism for tracking and logging the analysis process. It may include options that affect the debugging strategy or the interpretation of results.
      n - An integer that represents the current depth or iteration in the recursive debugging process. It is used to control the recursion and may influence the partitioning strategy or termination conditions of the algorithm.
      Returns:
      A List of Objects that represents the minimal unsatisfiable subset (MUS) found within the input set. This subset is the smallest collection of elements or constraints that, when considered together, render the Alloy model unsatisfiable.

    • partitionIntoNSubsets

      private static List<List<Object>> partitionIntoNSubsets(List<Object> c, int n)
      Partitions the given list into n subsets for use in the ddPlus algorithm.
      Parameters:
      c - The list of objects to partition.
      n - The desired number of subsets.
      Returns:
      A list of lists, where each inner list is a subset of the original list.

    • difference

      private static List<Object> difference(List<Object> a, List<Object> b)
      Computes the difference between two lists of objects.
      Parameters:
      a - The first list.
      b - The second list, whose elements will be removed from the first list.
      Returns:
      A list containing all elements of the first list that are not in the second list.
